result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • James E Borzick was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James E Borzick

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Marquette County Treatment Court Diversion Contract

10:09 AM Defendant James E Borzick in court.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court for James E Borzick.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Treatment Court Coordinator Alice Schlotte appears in court.
Atty Juech states plea agreement to Count 1.  Count 2 to be dismissed.  Atty Juech states that the defendant will be going into the Marquette County Treatment Court Program.   Atty Johnson agrees.  Defendant agrees.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

Atty Juech moves to amend Count 1 to remove the enhancer.  Atty Johnson has no objection.
BY THE COURT:  Court amends Count 1 to remove the enhancer.

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds the defendant guilty of the amended Count 1, OWI - 4th offense and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date.  Count 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Juech makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Johnson makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Count 1, OWI - 4th offense:  TREATMENT COURT PROGRAM:
Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
*Court orders 356 days in the Marquette County Jail; 305 days stayed for use for sanctions for the Treatment Court Program
Report forthwith
*Credit =  2 days (if revoked)
*Good Time
*Defendant to be allowed to get out of Jail for Treatment and Group Meetings for the Treatment Court Program
*Pay fine of $800 + costs = $2,046.00
*Blood Draw Reimbursement = $50.00 
*36 month Drivers License Revocation
*36 month Ignition Interlock (once reinstated)
*AODA and any follow-up treatment
*Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription & is disclosed to the Treatment Court Team
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol 
*Participate in and Graduate from the Treatment Court Program
*Compliance of all rules of the Treatment Court Program
*Random drug and alcohol screens as recommended by the Agent
*Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent  
Cash bond to be applied
Remaining costs to be paid through Probation

**Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm. 

Count 2 to be dismissed
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:04 PM Defendant James E Borzick appeared by phone. Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by video for James E Borzick.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Burdon provided the defendant with a treatment court offer.  Atty Johnson states that his client does wish to go into the treatment court program but he has to do some in-patient at the VA yet.  
Defendant doesn't know when he can go into the VA treatment. Atty Johnson asks that this be set for another status so he can confirm everything.

BY THE COURT:  set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Status hearing on October 10, 2022 at 11:45 am.

10:50 AM Defendant James E Borzick in court.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court for James E Borzick.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Burdon files the information electronically with the Court and emailed a copy to Atty Johnson.  Atty Johnson received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 
bond continued

Atty Johnson states that the defendant is looking into Treatment Court.
Atty Burdon will provide a Treatment Court offer to Atty Johnson within a week.

10:48 AM Defendant James E Borzick in court.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court for James E Borzick.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Johnson states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Burdon files the information electronically with the Court and emailed a copy to Atty Johnson.  Atty Johnson received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Status hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status hearing on October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:23 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James E Borzick appeared by phone.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by phone for James E Borzick. 
Atty Johnson requests matter be set for preliminary hearing.  
BY THE COURT:  Set for preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 13, 2022 at 10:45 am.

4:03 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James E Borzick appeared by phone.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by phone for James E Borzick. 
Atty Johnson states that the defendant did provide treatment records; requests another status date.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
Status hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on July 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return on Warrant Hearing
Status hearing on June 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

11:50 AM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James E Borzick in court.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court for James E Borzick. 
Defendant failed to appear yesterday.  
BY THE COURT:  Warrant quashed.

Court questions counsel.  Atty Johnson states that on his citation it stated July 25th so he thought that was the next court date.  

Atty Johnson asks for another status date.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
Status hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on June 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

3:43 PM Defendant James E Borzick not in court.  Attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by video for James E Borzick. 
Court questions as to why his client is not appearing today.  Atty Johnson is unsure but states that the defendant was possibly going into treatment.  
Atty Burdon requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.
Status hearing on May 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

04:02 PM Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by video means for Defendant James E Borzick. Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant James E Borzick not in court.
Atty Johnson makes statement as to the whereabouts of his client.  Will be sure he appears at all future hearings.  Needs a bit more time.  BY THE COURT:  Set for status.
  Status hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on March 21, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Status hearing on March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:06 AM Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by video means for Defendant James E Borzick. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for State of Wisconsin. Defendant James E Borzick appeared by phone means.
  Atty Johnson states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.   Atty Johnson states that the defendant will waive time limits.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.  
Defendant agrees with the waiver of time limits.

BY THE COURT:    Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing.
bond continued  Status hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
For Leave To File Additional Motions

  Court finds probable cause for the charge for Riverside purposes.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant does not qualify for Public Defender.  
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.    Court confirms address and phone.

Atty Burdon requests a $500 cash bond with conditions:
Atty Gumz makes bail arguments.

*Maintain Absolute Sobriety  Initial appearance scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
